Test Name: Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization (FISH) for Hematologic Disorders
Specimen Type: Bone marrow aspirate or peripheral blood smear slides
Purpose: To detect and localize specific DNA sequences and chromosomal abnormalities related to hematologic disorders.
Equipment: Fluorescence microscope, hybridization chamber, thermocycler or hybridization oven, incubator, microcentrifuge, vortex mixer, pipettes, humidity control system
